fields.description:
The new UI provides the functional match of the 5 dialogs in the volume landing page.

- create volume
- attach to instance
- detach from instance
- create snapshot from volume
- delete volume
- manage tags (re-use tag editor)
fields.summary: Functional Match of 5 Dialogs on Volume Landing Page

comments.body: Implemented in GUI-46 branch.  Pull request at https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/pull/23
[~dkavanagh], after you do code review on this, can you please reassign it to me for UX review? I'll need to review it prior to it going to QA. Thanks!

create volume:
- we used to default to one of the AZs instead of forcing a selection

attach to instance:
- could be more obvious how to attach from detail page. Delete gets a full button but attach/delete are off a little un-labeled menu next to status.
- the device field should default to a value. (regression)

detach from instance:
- could be more obvious how to attach from detail page. Delete gets a full button but attach/delete are off a little un-labeled menu next to status.
- should list instance and volume on dialog (regression)

create snapshot from volume: (covered in snapshot dialog, but this needs to allow for snapshot naming)

delete volume:
- It would be great to list volume ID as well as the name (which is listed) (regression)

manage tags:
- done acceptably via detail page
[~dkavanagh]: Want to take a stab at implementing some of the feedback you listed here?

doing re-work for issues listed
listing items as I tick them off;
- default to first AZ
- don't require description on snapshot
- suggested device name should be default. Only works when instance known, no client side updates for attach to arbitrary instance from volume page
- should list instance and volume on dialog (fixed on instance and volume detail pages)
- It would be great to list volume ID as well as the name (which is listed) (also fixed on vol detail page)
https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/pull/34
still needs to go to Jenny, AFAIK
[~dkavanagh]: ack, forgot to assign to Jenny for UX review.  Thanks for doing that!

* create: help should not display by default, but on request (discuss with Jenny)
* create: text missing about selecting AZ (done)
* create: snap names not showing in selector dropdown (done)
* delete: text does not match wireframe (done)
* attach: search within instance selector is not working. Typed first two letters of instance name and got "no records match" returned (done)
* attach: next available device mapping should be pre-populated. User should be able to accept this default without having to enter anything. (done)
* attach: help text should only display when requested.
* create snap from volume does not match wireframe (done)
* detach: does not match wireframe, also names should be emphasized over  IDs always, (not just here)! (done)
I know tag editor on "create snapshot from volume" is busted. I'll work with Kamal to fix that while you are doing UX review.

* Detach (from volume side): says "Are you sure you want to detach volume from the instance ?" but should say "Are you sure you want to detach volume <x> from instance <y>?" (looked fine to me)
* Detach (from instance side) is missing the display of the volume name (or ID if name not available) as well. It shows instance ID but can you check to be sure it will show the name if available, please? (done)
* Detach (from instance side) gave me a 403 forbidden error. If there's a problem I need to have a better error message than this, it's not helpful. (this needs to be attacked everywhere. there's an issue opened for it)
* Attach: instance name not showing up in dropdown (I used az PARTI00 which has instance Jack in it) (this is working for me)
* attach: device mapping is not prepopulated like it used to be, i shoudl not have to add it. (broken in vol version, we have 2 ways to build this selection list.. one in javascript, one in python. the javascript isn't using the names and the click listener isn't working on that version, which explains this bug)
* help on attach still needs to be fixed but i need to wireframe that, just noting it here.
* create snap from volume (volume side): volume name not displaying. (working for me)

With the exception of help and "attach: device mapping is not prepopulated like it used to be, i shoudl not have to add it. (broken in vol version, we have 2 ways to build this selection list.. one in javascript, one in python. the javascript isn't using the names and the click listener isn't working on that version, which explains this bug)"
The rest should be fine.

Mostly fixed. One outstanding issue really needs broader dev attention. We can't be building selection lists in both javascript and python. Hopefully, we can get a web service that the javascript can use to leverage the same code (this is a broader problem than just this)

Getting there, thank you! A few small things:

* Attach volume: should show name (ID), not the other way around, the way we do it in the rest of the app.
* status actions should not be under gear menu but should be implemented the way changes in instance status are implemented on the single instance view page.

Like my comment about device mapping not pre-populating, there is an issue with attach and the instance choices when called from the volumes landing page. The main cause of the inconsistency here is that the dialogs launched on the single views (like single volume view) get choices populated in python code. The versions that launch from the landing pages are using javascript to populate the choices. Therefore, changes in one place don't apply to the other place. I highlighted this problem elsewhere and think we really need to address it architecturally to avoid a) duplicated effort and b) errors due to inconsistent implementations.

https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/pull/100

that's right.. PR #100!
[~dkavanagh][~kgill][~neil], can we be sure this architectural issue gets discussed (and hopefully resolved) at today's team meeting, please? Thank you!

[~dkavanagh], [~jloza], [~neil]
Nowhere are we populating form field choices via JavaScript.  All choices are populated in Python in the respective form class.  The JS simply reconfigures some of the select fields to a "Chosen" widget.  Unless I'm missing something here?

Had a good discussion with [~dkavanagh] in IRC.  The one edge case where we had to restrict the list of instances via JS is on the attach volume to instance dialog on the volumes landing page, in order to prevent attaching a volume to an instance in a different availability zone.  The full list of instances is passed from the server, and the list is filtered based on the selected volume's zone.  We had to leverage JS to handle this edge case to prevent the said error.

There are always going to be edge cases, and this is a reasonable example of breaking the "Keep things DRY" rule to improve the user experience.

/cc [~jloza], [~neil]
Fixed the issue of missing instance names in the attach volume to instance dialog on the volumes landing page in https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/pull/102
